colors.M: Material provides alerts box in four colors as you can see in the below display box.severity prop not only gives color to the Alert component, but sets an icon as well as per the severity value. color property can also be used, but by default it sets the icon for its values as checkCircleOutline . Thus you can remove or override icon using the icon prop. Set it to false to remove icon or specify some other material icon.
colors.B: Bootstrap provides a variety of colors for their Alert box which can be applied using its variant prop. By default, its variant props has primary value. Also, bootstrap dosen't apply any icons to its Alert by default. You have to use bootstrap-icons with the <i></i> tags as shown below in order to include icons alongwith alert content.

alertContent.M: Material provides with <AlertTitle/> component for adding heading/title to the Alert component.
alertContent.B: Bootstrap has two components, namely <Alert.Heading/> & <Alert.Link/> for adding heading and links to our component.

variants.M: Material provides variety of variants from which standard is the default one.
variants.B: Bootstrap dosen't provide any other Alert variants other than its standard filled Alert. But you can customize them by providing inline styles or overriding bootstrap classes.

dismissable.M: In Material an alert can have an action , such as a close button. If an onClose prop is set and no action props is there, then a close icon is displayed by default, else you can provide your custom icon or button in action.
dismissable.B: Bootstrap allows you to set dismissible props to your alert and displays a close icon by default. Further functionality is displayed in code using const [open,setOpen] = useState , react hooks.
